data.current_description: Use this endpoint to create a new marketing email.

Returns the created PublicEmail object with a generated emailId and initial version information.

data.summary_suggestion: Archive or delete a marketing email.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes or archives a marketing email by its emailId. This operation removes the email from active use and may move it to an archived state depending on system configuration. The email will no longer be available for sending or editing. Requires the emailId parameter and appropriate permissions. Returns a success response with no content body.

data.current_summary: Unpublish or cancel a marketing email.
data.current_description: If you have a Marketing Hub Enterprise account or the transactional email add-on, you can use this endpoint to unpublish an automated email or cancel a regular email. If the email is already in the process of being sent, canceling might not be possible.
data.summary_suggestion: Unpublish or cancel a marketing email
data.description_suggestion: Unpublish an automated email or cancel a regular email. Requires Marketing Hub Enterprise account or transactional email add-on. This operation stops the email from being sent and removes it from active distribution. Note: If the email is already in the process of being sent, cancellation may not be possible. Returns the updated email object with status reflecting the unpublished or cancelled state.
data.reasoning: Summary has unnecessary period. Description mentions access requirements but lacks clarity about the side effects (email stops being sent, removed from distribution) and return value. data.current_summary: Publish or send a marketing email.
data.current_description: If you have a Marketing Hub Enterprise account or the transactional email add-on, you can use this endpoint to publish an automated email or send/schedule a regular email.
data.summary_suggestion: Publish or send a marketing email
data.description_suggestion: Publishes an automated email or sends/schedules a regular marketing email. Requires a Marketing Hub Enterprise account or transactional email add-on. The emailId parameter specifies which email to publish. This operation transitions the email from draft state to published/sent state. Returns the updated PublicEmail object with current status and scheduling information.
data.reasoning: Original description focuses on account requirements but lacks clarity on inputs, outputs, and state changes. data.current_summary: Create an A/B test variation of a marketing email.
data.current_description: Create a variation of a marketing email for an A/B test. The new variation will be created as a draft. If an active variation already exists, a new one won't be created.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new A/B test variation of a marketing email based on the AbTestCreateRequestVNext request body. The new variation is created in draft state. If an active variation already exists, the operation will not create a new one and will return an error. Returns the newly created PublicEmail variation object with A/B testing metadata. This operation enables A/B testing workflows for marketing emails.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description needs enhancement to clarify the request schema requirement, the error behavior when a variation exists, the response structure, and the purpose within the A/B testing workflow. data.current_summary: Get the variation of a an A/B marketing email
data.current_description: This endpoint lets you obtain the variation of an A/B marketing email. If the email is variation A (master) it will return variation B (variant) and vice versa.
data.summary_suggestion: Get the alternate A/B test variation of an email
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the alternate A/B test variation for a marketing email. If the specified emailId is variation A (master), returns variation B (variant), and vice versa. Returns the PublicEmail object of the alternate variation with its A/B testing metadata. Requires the emailId parameter to identify the email whose variation should be retrieved.

data.current_description: Resets the draft back to a copy of the live object.
data.summary_suggestion: Reset email draft to live version
data.description_suggestion: Resets the draft version of a marketing email to match the current live/published version. This operation overwrites any unsaved changes in the draft. The emailId parameter specifies which email's draft to reset. Returns the updated PublicEmail object in draft state. Useful for discarding draft changes and starting fresh from the published version.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic and not action-oriented. Description uses unclear terminology ('live object'). Added clarity about what 'live' means (published version), the destructive nature of the operation (overwrites changes), the parameter requirement, the response schema, and the use case for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Restore a revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state
data.current_description: Restores a previous revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state. If there is currently something in the draft for that object, it is overwritten.
data.description_suggestion: Restores a previous revision of a marketing email to DRAFT state, making it the current working draft. The emailId and revisionId parameters specify which email revision to restore. If a draft currently exists, it will be overwritten by this operation. Returns the restored PublicEmail object in draft state with version metadata. This enables reverting to earlier email versions for editing.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to clarify the two required parameters (emailId and revisionId), the destructive nature of overwriting existing drafts, the response structure including version metadata, and the use case. Added these details for improved AI agent understanding of the operation's inputs, outputs, and effects.
